titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Marjorie Child Husted photograph, 1949 RL.11276
titlestmt.author: Richard Collier

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-05-15 11:08:50 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

origination.label: source
origination.corpname: John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History

did.abstract: Marjorie Child Husted was a home economist employed by General Mills to promote the Betty Crocker brand. Photograph of Husted by Newspaper Enterprise Association. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Marjorie Child Husted photograph were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a purchase in 2016.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Marjorie Child Husted photograph, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 2016-0134

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Consists of a 5x7 black-and-white photograph of Husted seated at a desk. Inscription on back reads "Marjorie Child Husted. General Mills, Inc. Minneapolis. Advertising Woman of the Year, June 1949. Ref. Dept.1-8-50 N.E.A." Numbered twice: 5x7 407795 and A28496. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center collections:
J. Walter Thompson Company Iconographic collection
